messages.title: Putting You First
messages.content: Helen Jones is proud to live in Warrington North with her family and uses the same shops and services as constituents. She criticizes the Tories and LibDems for not caring about Warrington and emphasizes the struggle of working people. She promises to fight for better funding and services.

policyDescription: Campaign for secure jobs and a living wage
Fight to save A&E and protect hospital services
Ensure defense for our country and effective local deterrent
Fight for world-class schools and opportunities for children

issues.brexitEurope: Brexit: PM tried to sabotage Article 50. Helen respects the referendum result.
issues.education: School funding, increasing school capacity, providing top-class resources to children.
issues.health: Fight to save A&E and protect hospital services.
issues.labourEmployment: Campaigns for secure jobs and a living wage.

community.content: Supporting local communities, protecting green spaces like Peel Hall.

leaflet.personalStatement: Helen was born in Chester, grew up on a council estate, was the first person in her family to go to university, and is a former teacher.

politicalExperience.achievements: Chairs the new Select Committee on Petitions, campaigned for equal weight for voters' voices, various successful campaigns including against HS2 and saving local amenities.

endorsements.endorsement: Thank you for your valiant support, commitment and passion for our cause.

quotes.text: Thank you, Helen – this Warringtonian is proud to call you my MP.
There were many tears of joy and thanks for your continued support, Helen.
Well done on fighting the corner of retail workers.

examples: One tube line in London than on every transport project in the North combined.
On June 8th, vote for the candidate who always puts you first.
Too many people here are working hard, but struggling to make ends meet.
Parents see the cost of childcare going up five times as fast as their wages.
Campaign to secure jobs and a living wage for everyone in Warrington North.
To oppose plans to destroy our communities, whether it be HS2, fracking, or taking our green spaces like Peel Hall.
To fight to save our A&E and protect services at our local hospital.
Local campaigns against litter, fly-tipping and housing issues.
Increasing school capacity and providing top-class resources for children.
Campaigning for better local broadband and fighting against HS2.

personalStories.story: Helen was born in Chester, grew up on a council estate, was the first person in her family to go to university, and is a former teacher.

examples: Thank you for your valiant support, commitment and passion for our cause.
Thank you, Helen – this Warringtonian is proud to call you my MP.
Well done on fighting the corner of retail workers.
Once again, Helen has led the fight to save Peel Hall and protect one of the last green spaces in North Warrington.
The Tories won't invest here. They've cut funding for our schools to spend more in counties like Surrey. Our hospital has lost services and now our A&E is under threat.
The Prime Minister says MPs tried to sabotage Brexit.
Tories and LibDems in Westminster who don't care about Warrington.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Helen lives in Warrington North with her family and uses the same shops and services as constituents.
nonPolicyAttributes.employment: Helen was a teacher before becoming an MP.
nonPolicyAttributes.education: Helen was the first person in her family to go to university.
nonPolicyAttributes.family: Helen lives in Warrington North with her family.

examples: Helen lives in Warrington North with her family and uses the same shops and services as constituents.
